text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something Attack on Titan themed,

and I thought, we’ve never made something
from Attack on Titan, so that is
exactly what we’re gonna do today.
For those of you who aren’t familiar,

Attack on Titan is an animated series, I’m
watching online on Hulu.

It’s about humans fighting Titans, giants,
giants who eat people, so that’s not good!

I decided to go a little overboard and get
into the spirit, I tried to dress up

as Mikasa, she’s one of the characters from
the show, she is a scout.

The scouts are on all these little
pulley systems, so they can scale
big walls, they’re kind like of Spidermen.
They like, move around it’s really,
really cool.

She works on the Survey Corps, and their logo
looks like this…

So today, we’re gonna be making Attack on
Titan Tarts, with the Suvery Corps logo.
Let’s get started!

The tarts that we’re gonna be making today
are gonna have 2 types of pudding
filling, we have a caramel and a milk.
So the thing you’ll need for the

caramel filling will be: 1 cup of whole milk,
1 cup of brown sugar, 2

egg yolks, 4 tablespoons of all purpose flour,
2 tablespoons of butter and
1 teaspoon of vanilla.

And then to make the milk pudding: 3/4 cup
of heavy cream,

4 teaspoons of sugar, 1/2 a teaspoon of powdered
gelatin, 1/8th of a teaspoon

of powdered black food coloring and 1 tablespoon
of water.

Then to decorate you’re gonna need blue
and white candy melts, some chocolate

chips, we’re gonna melt them to line the
bottom of the tarts.

And I’ve got some pre-made tart shells over
here.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we’re
gonna brush the bottom of the

tart shells with our melted chocolate, so
that they don’t get soggy!

So I’ve got a little baking brush, but if
you don’t you can use a teaspoon,
you can scoop in.

Brush the bottom, I like to use a brush because
I can get
a very even spread.

Then you’re gonna do this to the rest of
your tart shells.

I just finished lining all of my tart shells,
I set them off to the side,

and now the next thing that we’re gonna
do is we’re gonna make the caramel
filling for these yummy little tarts.

So I’ve got a saucepan over here first thing
that we’re gonna do is crack
our eggs.
Remember, you just want the yolks.

I’m gonna do the jiggle method, I’m getting
all the egg white out, pop
him over here in our pan, boop!

We don’t need these egg whites, but you
can save them.
You can make a little egg white scramble, that’s what I like to eat in the morning.

So I’m gonna set this off to the side, then
we’re gonna add our brown sugar to
the pan and our vanilla extract.

Now we’re gonna take our pan and our cream,
flour and butter over to the stove!
On a low heat, whisk together the brown sugar, egg yolks, and vanilla until the sugar melts.

Then whisk in the flower, until there are
no more lumps.

Now whisk in the milk and increase the heat
to medium.

Stirring constantly, cook the pudding until
it thickens.

When the pudding is thick, turn off the heat
and stir in your butter.
Once it’s melted, remove from the stove.

I took the caramel pudding off the stove,
I let it sit for about 20 minutes

to chill, because before we put them into
the tarts you don’t want it to be hot,
because it will melt the chocolate filling.

But now, it’s ready! we’re gonna take
a little spoonful, and this caramel pudding

is very rich, so you’re just gonna want
a very thin layer.
Gonna dab some in there, dab-dab-dab-dab-dab.

Then I’m gonna use the spoon to flatten
it.

Then you’re gonna do this to the rest of
your tarts.

I set the tarts off to the side again, and
now we are gonna make our second
pudding, our milk pudding.

It’s really easy, the first thing that we’re
gonna do

is we’re gonna combine our water with the
gelatin, oooooooh!

Take a little spoon, mix it around and we
wait for it to bloom.

Now we’re gonna pour our cream and sugar
into our pot.

Now we’re gonna take our bloomed gelatin,
our black powdered food coloring
and our pot over to the stove.

Turn your heat to medium and allow your sugar
to melt.
Once the cream starts

to bubble around the edges of the pot, whisk
to combine the remaining sugar.

Then whisk the bloomed gelatin and the powdered
food coloring until the
gelatin is completely melted.

Once it’s completely melted, turn off the
heat
and remove from the stove!

I just took the milk pudding off the stove,
and I transferred it to a measuring

cup, the reason I did this is because it has
a pour spigot.

Because we’re gonna be pouring it into our
tarts.
I would suggest something

with a pour spigot, just to make your life
a little bit easier.

So over here, I have the tarts on top of a
baking tray, the reason I’m doing

this is because when you’re transferring
them to the fridge…
Oooooh!

Any shaking can cause the pudding to spill
out.
And if it’s easier, you can put

your tarts in the fridge right now and then
pour the milk pudding.
Slowly pour in, cover the caramel pudding.
Perfect!
Bewm!
Then fill up the rest of your tarts.

Now our tarts are ready and you are gonna
very carefully transfer these over to
the fridge.

We’re gonna let them chill for about 35-40
minutes.

And while they’re chilling in the fridge,
we’re gonna make our Survey Corps decorations!

Now it’s time to make some decorations,
over here I made a template.

This is the Survey Corps Logo, and I just
made this little template in

photoshop, I’ll put a link down below if
you guys want to download it and use it!

I put the piece of paper underneath a piece
of wax paper, I taped it down,

and I just put it on the back of a little
baking sheet.

I’m doing this so I can pick them up, and
move them around, this is just what
I had handy.

I’ve melted my candy over here, I put it
in a plastic baggie
with a number 1…
Tip, ooop!
He’s all ready, look at that! He's ready to go!
That’s OK, I’ll have, a little snack!

OK, so the first thing that I’m gonna do
is pipe the border of the shield,
and an ‘X’.

I let the outline set for just a couple minutes,
and now, we’re gonna do this side of the feathers!

This is a very intricate design, so I’m
gonna simplify it a little bit,

this is totally optional, but I’m gonna
pipe this feather as one whole piece.

For our final details, we are gonna decorate
using our blue candy melts!

Here I’ve heated them up, I put them into
a plastic baggie with, again,

a number 1 tip at the end for a little bit
more control.

And now we’re gonna pipe on the second part
of our design, the blue feathers!

Once you’ve piped all of your designs you’re
gonna let them sit for about 10
minutes at room temperature.

But if you’re in a hurry you can pop these
in the

refrigerator, they will set very quickly,
just a couple minutes!
Oh you guys!

I took my tarts out of the fridge and we have
all of our designs,
it is time to assemble them.

You want to be gentle when you’re removing
your designs, I like to use a large

knife, so that there’s a lot of surface
area and it’s very flat.

And I’m gonna slowly pull the design on
the edge, ooooh!
Just like that!
There we go!

Sometimes I like to make extra designs, just
in case
they break, because that happens!

And then I’m gonna transfer it right over
here, right into the middle of our tart.
AH!
We did it!
You guys, this looks amazing!

Now we’re gonna do this to the rest of our
tarts.
Ta-da!

Here are the Attack on Titan Tarts that we
made today!

I’m so excited because this is the first
time we’ve made a recipe for the show!
They look just like the Survey Corps Logo!

I’m gonna be taking lots of pictures and
posting them on Facebook, Tumblr,
Instagram and Twitter.

And if you guys make these, please take a
picture and

send it to me, I love seeing your baking creations,
it just makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
And, now Mikasa can have one for herself!
Mmmmm!
Oops…
Mikasa’s a little messy….
